text: Socialist Party of Serbia is a political party in Serbia. It is a left-wing populist and "social-democratic" party. The Socialist Party of Serbia was set up by former Serbian Yugolsav dictator * * * * * Slobodan Milošević. It is now led by Ivica Dačić. ==In power== Under the rule of the Socialist Party of Serbia, the Yugoslav state committed genocide and other crimes against humanity against Bosniaks, Croats and Albanians across the Balkans, * * * * * * * * * * with support from many left-wing "anti-imperialists", who have huge influence in Western academia and history writing. * Lappin, Shalom (2006), ‘How Class Disappeared from Western Politics’, Dissent, Vol. 51, No. 1, pp. 73-78. * * * * Kirsch, Adam (2024), On Settler Colonialism: Ideology, Violence, and Justice, W.W. Norton and Company, New York and London. * * * * * ==War crimes trials== ===International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia=== ====2007 rulings==== Following his death, in four separate rulings, Slobodan Milošević was found to be a part of a joint criminal enterprise which used crimes to remove Croats, Bosniaks and Albanians from large parts of Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, and Kosovo.
